snippet: Newspaper industry revenue in the United States fell last year, as increases in circulation revenue were not high enough to make up for shrinking demand for print advertising, an industry trade group said on Friday.
abstract: Newspaper Association of America reports industry revenue fell 2.6 percent, to $37.6 billion, in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Newspaper industry revenue in the United States fell last year, as increases in circulation revenue were not high enough to make up for shrinking demand for print advertising, an industry trade group said on Friday.

headline.main: Newspaper Industry Takes It on the Chin, Again
headline.print_headline: Newspaper Industry Revenue Fell 2.6% Last Year
